item.title: Offensive graffiti on a building in the park, 30th December
item.description:
Hi, I want to complain about the graffiti that says “Shut down the NHS” on the side of a building in the car park of King George’s recreation ground near to the Met police park. It makes me sad because my mum works for the NHS, plus me and my friends have lots of family members being cared for by the NHS at the moment. Please can you paint over it, or me and my school friends could help to do this? Thank you, Luke Hudson 9 years old (Birkbeck Primary School)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsmead Close, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dirt motorbike damage to park, 30th December
item.description:
Once again in Stoneham park we have an urgent issue with the large number of motorbikes gaining access to the park and tearing around damaging the ground and newly plant conservation areas. These kids on the bikes has harassed and been rude and intimidating to dog walkers and others using the park for walking. These bikes race around the park in between dogs and their owners thinking it’s funny. This park had this issue before and in the end people had to call the police before someone got badly hurt. Therefore on return from you Xmas break we expect the council to put a stop to this going on. And replace the signs on both gates of the park stating No Motor Vehicles allowed”.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shearwood Crescent, North End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Down bin alley of Perrin House and on pavement, 30th December
item.description:
Fly tip in the bin alley of Perrin House over the weekend of 20-21 Dec. Probably because of the fly tipped rubbish outside the bins, the bin men have ignored the fly tipped rubbish and not put the bins back properly for two weeks in a row. Some bins have been on the street for over a week. There are no managerial staff at the sheltered housing of Perrin House so this has not been dealt with. It needs to be cleared.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Malvern Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load
